comments:
This is related to my previous bug reports:
see bug #88623 which was marked a duplicate of bug #86177 (fixed).

This is the report for variant 1 crash described in #88623.

I now use Eclipse 3.1M6 + CDT 3.1M6 + WTP 1.0 (I20050422).

My first report was aimed generically at the Platform product, but I somehow
managed to track it down to the Ant editor (at least it seems to me).

The description of variant 1 in bug #88623 is still valid, but It seems that the
bug is triggered while editing an Ant file with the Ant editor.
More specifically: sometimes, when saving the Ant editor content and very
quickly thereafter trying to run a target from the Ant view, the bug triggers.

The last two stack traces in the log file is the following, but there are many
more like these in the log file (already in reverse order, i.e. most recent first):

Created an attachment (id=20363)
eclipse log file

Adding full log file for the bug just reported.

From the stack traces that you have provided this is my interpretation: 

The AntSecurityException is thrown in M6 if a system property is attempted to 
be set from the AntEditor or during a ...see bug 60860.

when you application runs out of handles this is an indication that some OS 
resources are not getting correctly freed during the lifecycle of the 
application. It is very rarely the case that it is actually the current code 
running that is actually causing the problem...it just happens to be the 
unlucky code that asks for a new handle can that fails.
I have profiled the AntEditor many many times for leakage / resource problems 
and have not found problems in the recent past.

I have never seen these problems but I do not work with CDT or WTP.

I am sorry but I don't know what I could do in Ant land.
Marking as later for future investigation.
